item.title: A sapling matures: meet sq 1.0
item.description:
The Sequoia PGP project has announced version 1.0 of the sq command-line tool for managing OpenPGP encryption and signatures. It also provides a decentralized public key infrastructure (PKI), and key management facilities. This is the first stable release since development began on the project in 2017.

sq's PKI is probably its most notable feature, and the one we invested the most time in. The PKI is used to authenticate certificates, and messages. Authentication is necessary to ensure that you are encrypting to the person you think you are, and to identify who really authored a message; without authentication, encryption and verification are much weaker.

item.title: Fedora Linux Grappling With New vs. Old Intel Hardware Support For Compute Stack
item.description: Fedora is among the Linux distributions that package up the Intel Compute Runtime stack to make it easy to run OpenCL and oneAPI Level Zero workloads on Intel graphics hardware via the distribution package manager and without having to jump through any extra hoops. But now with upstream Intel Compute Runtime dropping support for Ice Lake and older leaves the Fedora support in a pickle. Currently they are focusing on the "legacy" branch with older hardware support but for Fedora 42 are looking at upgrading the support to focus on newer Intel graphics hardware support while leaving that older hardware support behind...

item.description: Following a short bullish correction, the crypto market cap has bounced to $3.75 trillion, with assets reflecting both profits and setbacks. In the face of mixed sentiment, EigenLayer (EIGEN) has hit a new all-time high at $5.65.  The prolonged 117% rally of EIGEN over the past thirty days fueled the

item.title: FTX Set to Distribute $16 Billion to Creditors Starting 60 Days After January 3 Record Date
item.description: In a major development for victims of the collapsed FTX exchange, the Court-approved Chapter 11 Plan of Reorganization is set to become effective on January 3, 2025. This huge milestone comes after over two years of the exchange’s downfall in November 2022. The Initial Distribution will be limited to holders

item.title: CyberKongz Fights Back Against SEC Wells Notice Over Contract Migration
item.description: CyberKongz, a prominent NFT project, has announced that it has received a Wells Notice from the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), signaling potential enforcement action. The project expressed disappointment in the SEC’s stance, arguing that the regulator’s misunderstanding of blockchain technology has led to unfair accusations.  CyberKongz has received

item.title: Can BGB Reach $5 Before a Possible Pullback?
item.description: Bitget Token (BGB) has witnessed a remarkable surge, climbing 11% in the past 24 hours and reaching an all-time high (ATH) of $3.65 just hours ago. This rally has cemented BGB’s impressive monthly gain of 162%, with the token currently trading at $3.62. The price action of BGB has drawn

item.title: Trump FCC chair wants to revoke broadcast licenses—the 1st Amendment might stop him
item.description: Brendan Carr backs Trump's war against media, but revoking licenses won't be easy.

item.title: China orbits first Guowang Internet satellites, with thousands more to come
item.description: China launched the first 10 spacecraft in a planned constellation of 13,000 Internet satellites.

item.title: LLVM Merges TySan As Sanitizer For Type-Based Aliasing Violations
item.description: The LLVM compiler stack offers a number of sanitizers like the AddressSanitizer, MemorySanitizer, UndefinedBehaviorSanitizer, and others for detecting different coding issues like data races, memory addressing issues, use of uninitialized memory, and more. The newest sanitizer addition to LLVM mainline is TySan as a Type Sanitizer...

item.title: NVIDIA Launches $249 "Gen AI Supercomputer" With Jetson Orin Nano Super Developer Kit
item.description: NVIDIA today announced the Jetson Orin Nano Super Developer Kit as their "most affordable generative AI Supercomputer" with this upgraded Jetson Nano offering 1.7x better GenAI performance while also costing less than its predecessor. This new product looks like an exciting addition to the NVIDIA Jetson line-up and will have performance benchmarks soon on Phoronix...

item.title: Graphite Network Launches L1 Blockchain with Entry Node Rewards
item.description:
Graphite Network has launched its layer-1 blockchain with faster transactions, lower fees, and a trust-based model to address Ethereum’s scalability challenges.

The post Graphite Network Launches L1 Blockchain with Entry Node Rewards appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Traditional Gaming Pros Overtake Blockchain Experts in Web3 Game Companies: BGA Report 2024
item.description:
Traditional gaming professionals now hold a larger share of roles in Web3 game companies, surpassing blockchain and cryptocurrency specialists.

The post Traditional Gaming Pros Overtake Blockchain Experts in Web3 Game Companies: BGA Report 2024 appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Hong Kong Pledges Crypto Asset Reporting Framework by 2026 to Combat Tax Evasion
item.description:
Hong Kong has committed to implementing the Crypto-Asset Reporting Framework (CARF) by 2026, aiming to enhance tax transparency and combat cross-border tax evasion, with automatic exchanges set to begin in 2028.

The post Hong Kong Pledges Crypto Asset Reporting Framework by 2026 to Combat Tax Evasion appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Kali Linux 2024.4 released
item.description: Version 2024.4 of the Kali Linux penetration-testing distribution has been released. Changes include a switch to Python 3.12, the removal of i386 kernel support, GNOME 47, and more.

item.title: Security updates for Tuesday
item.description: Security updates have been issued by Debian (gstreamer1.0), Fedora (jupyterlab and python-notebook), Oracle (gimp:2.8.22, gstreamer1-plugins-base, gstreamer1-plugins-good, kernel, php:8.2, postgresql, and python3.11), SUSE (aws-iam-authenticator, firefox, installation-images, kernel, libaom, libyuv, libsoup, libsoup2, python-aiohttp, socat, thunderbird, and vim), and Ubuntu (curl, Docker, imagemagick, and kernel).

item.title: Hackers Use Microsoft MSC Files to Deploy Obfuscated Backdoor in Pakistan Attacks
item.description:
A new phishing campaign has been observed employing tax-themed lures to deliver a stealthy backdoor payload as part of attacks targeting Pakistan.
Cybersecurity company Securonix, which is tracking the activity under the name FLUX#CONSOLE, said it likely starts with a phishing email link or attachment, although it said it couldn't obtain the original email used to launch the attack.

item.title: Even Great Companies Get Breached — Find Out Why and How to Stop It
item.description:
Even the best companies with the most advanced tools can still get hacked. It’s a frustrating reality: you’ve invested in the right solutions, trained your team, and strengthened your defenses. But breaches still happen.
So, what’s going wrong? The truth is, that attackers are constantly finding new ways to slip through cracks that often go unnoticed—even in well-prepared organizations. The good
